types.name: EVSE
types.description: The EVSE data which extends OCPI EVSE

fields.name: uid
fields.description:
Uniquely identifies the EVSE within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms). For example a database ID or the actual "EVSE ID". This field can never be changed, modified or renamed. This is the 'technical' identification of the EVSE, not to be used as 'human readable' identification, use the field evse_id for that.
This field is named uid instead of id, because id could be confused with evse_id which is an eMI3 defined field.

fields.name: evse_id
fields.description: Compliant with the following specification for EVSE ID from "eMI3 standard version V1.0" (http://emi3group.com/documents-links/) "Part 2: business objects." Optional because: if an evse_id is to be re-used in the real world, the evse_id can be removed from an EVSE object if the status is set to REMOVED.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Indicates the current status of the EVSE.

fields.name: status_schedule
fields.description: Indicates a planned status update of the EVSE.

fields.name: capabilities
fields.description: List of functionalities that the EVSE is capable of.

fields.name: connectors
fields.description: List of available connectors on the EVSE.

fields.name: floor_level
fields.description: Level on which the Charge Point is located (in garage buildings) in the locally displayed numbering scheme.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: Coordinates of the EVSE.

fields.name: physical_reference
fields.description: A number/string printed on the outside of the EVSE for visual identification.

fields.name: parking_restrictions
fields.description: The restrictions that apply to the parking spot.

fields.name: images
fields.description: Links to images related to the EVSE such as photos or logos.

fields.name: last_updated

types.name: OCPIStatus
types.description: The status of an EVSE.

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is able to start a new charging session.

enumValues.name: BLOCKED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is not accessible because of a physical barrier, i.e. a car.

enumValues.name: CHARGING
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is in use.

enumValues.name: INOPERATIVE
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is not yet active or it is no longer available (deleted).

enumValues.name: OUTOFORDER
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is currently out of order.

enumValues.name: PLANNED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is planned, will be operating soon.

enumValues.name: REMOVED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector was discontinued/removed.

enumValues.name: RESERVED
enumValues.description: The EVSE/Connector is reserved for a particular EV driver and is unavailable for other drivers.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: No status information available (also used when offline).

types.name: OCPIStatusSchedule
types.description: This type is used to schedule status periods in the future. The eMSP can provide this information to the EV user for trip planning purposes. A period MAY have no end. Example: "This station will be running as of tomorrow. Today it is still planned and under construction.

fields.name: period_begin
fields.description: Begin of the scheduled period.

fields.name: period_end
fields.description: End of the scheduled period, if known.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status value during the scheduled period.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The `DateTime` scalar represents a date and time following the ISO 8601 standard

types.name: OCPICapability
types.description: The capabilities of an EVSE.

enumValues.name: CHARGING_PROFILE_CAPABLE
enumValues.description: The EVSE supports charging profiles.

enumValues.name: CHARGING_PREFERENCES_CAPABLE
enumValues.description: The EVSE supports charging preferences.

enumValues.name: CHIP_CARD_SUPPORT
enumValues.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that supports chip cards.

enumValues.name: CONTACTLESS_CARD_SUPPORT
enumValues.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that supports contactless cards.

enumValues.name: CREDIT_CARD_PAYABLE
enumValues.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that makes it possible to pay for charging using a credit card.

enumValues.name: DEBIT_CARD_PAYABLE
enumValues.description: EVSE has a payment terminal that makes it possible to pay for charging using a debit card.

enumValues.name: PED_TERMINAL
enumValues.description: EVSE has a payment terminal with a pin-code entry device.

enumValues.name: REMOTE_START_STOP_CAPABLE
enumValues.description: The EVSE can remotely be started/stopped.

enumValues.name: RESERVABLE
enumValues.description: The EVSE can be reserved.

enumValues.name: RFID_READER
enumValues.description: Charging at this EVSE can be authorized with an RFID token.

enumValues.name: TOKEN_GROUP_CAPABLE
enumValues.description: This EVSE supports token groups, two or more tokens work as one, so that a session can be started with one token and stopped with another (handy when a card and key-fob are given to the EV-driver).

enumValues.name: UNLOCK_CAPABLE
enumValues.description: Connectors have a mechanical lock that can be requested by the eMSP to be unlocked.

types.name: Connector
types.description: The connector data which extends OCPI Connector

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier of the Connector within the EVSE. Two Connectors may have the same id as long as they do not belong to the same EVSE object.

fields.name: standard
fields.description: The standard of the installed connector.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The format (socket/cable) of the installed connector.

fields.name: power_type
fields.description: The type of the power of the installed connector.

fields.name: max_voltage
fields.description: Maximum voltage of the connector (line to neutral for AC_3_PHASE), in volt [V]. For example: DC Chargers might vary the voltage during charging when battery almost full.

fields.name: max_amperage
fields.description: Maximum amperage of the connector, in ampere [A].

fields.name: max_electric_power
fields.description:
Maximum electric power that can be delivered by this connector, in watt [W]. When the maximum electric power is lower than the calculated value from voltage and amperage, this value should be set.
For example: A DC Charge Point which can delivers up to 920V and up to 400A can be limited to a maximum of 150kW. Depending on the car, it may supply maximum voltage or current, but not both at the same time.
For AC Charge Points, the amount of phases used can also have influence on the maximum power.

fields.name: power
fields.description: Maximum electric power in kW

fields.name: tariff_ids
fields.description:
Identifiers of the currently valid charging tariffs. Multiple tariffs are possible, but only one of each Tariff.type can be active at the same time. Tariffs with the same type are only allowed, if they are not active at the same time: start_date_time and end_date_time period not overlapping.
When preference-based smart charging is supported, one tariff for every possible ProfileType should be provided. These tell the user about the options they have at this Connector, and what the tariff is for every option.
For a "free of charge" tariff, this field should be set and point to a defined "free of charge" tariff.

fields.name: terms_and_conditions
fields.description: URL to the operators terms and conditions.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when this Connector was last updated (or created).

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Optional object where you can store custom data you need in your application and extend the current functionalities which we offer

fields.name: tariff
fields.description: The list if valid charging tariffs

types.name: OCPIConnectorFormat
types.description: The format of the connector, whether it is a socket or a plug.

enumValues.name: SOCKET
enumValues.description: The connector is a socket; the EV user needs to bring a fitting plug.

enumValues.name: CABLE
enumValues.description: The connector is an attached cable; the EV users car needs to have a fitting inlet.

enumValues.name: AC_1_PHASE
enumValues.description: AC single phase.

enumValues.name: AC_3_PHASE
enumValues.description: AC three phase.

enumValues.name: DC
enumValues.description: Direct Current.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code of the CPO that owns this Tariff.

fields.name: party_id
fields.description: CPO ID of the CPO that owns this Tariff (following the ISO-15118 standard).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Uniquely identifies the tariff within the CPOs platform (and suboperator platforms).

fields.name: currency
fields.description: ISO-4217 code of the currency of this tariff.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Defines the type of the tariff. This allows for distinction in case of given Charging Preferences. When omitted, this tariff is valid for all sessions.

fields.name: tariff_alt_text
fields.description: List of multi-language alternative tariff info texts.

fields.name: tariff_alt_url
fields.description: URL to a web page that contains an explanation of the tariff information in human readable form.

fields.name: min_price
fields.description: When this field is set, a Charging Session with this tariff will at least cost this amount. This is different from a FLAT fee (Start Tariff, Transaction Fee), as a FLAT fee is a fixed amount that has to be payed for any Charging Session. A minimum price indicates that when the cost of a Charging Session is lower than this amount, the cost of the Session will be equal to this amount. (Also see note below)

fields.name: max_price
fields.description: When this field is set, a Charging Session with this tariff will NOT cost more than this amount. (See note below)

fields.name: elements
fields.description: List of Tariff Elements.

fields.name: start_date_time
fields.description: The time when this tariff becomes active, in UTC, time_zone field of the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used for a new tariff that is already given with the location, before it becomes active. (See note below)

fields.name: end_date_time
fields.description: The time after which this tariff is no longer valid, in UTC, time_zone field if the Location can be used to convert to local time. Typically used when this tariff is going to be replaced with a different tariff in the near future. (See note below)

fields.name: energy_mix
fields.description: Details on the energy supplied with this tariff.

fields.name: last_updated
fields.description: Timestamp when this Tariff was last updated (or created).

enumValues.name: AD_HOC_PAYMENT
enumValues.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when ad-hoc payment is used at the Charge Point (for example: Debit or Credit card payment terminal).

enumValues.name: PROFILE_CHEAP
enumValues.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when Charging Preference: CHEAP is set for the session.

enumValues.name: PROFILE_FAST
enumValues.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when Charging Preference: FAST is set for the session.

enumValues.name: PROFILE_GREEN
enumValues.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when Charging Preference: GREEN is set for the session.

enumValues.name: REGULAR
enumValues.description: Used to describe that a Tariff is valid when using an RFID, without any Charging Preference, or when Charging Preference: REGULAR is set for the session.

fields.name: excl_vat
fields.description: Price/Cost excluding VAT.

fields.name: incl_vat
fields.description: Price/Cost including VAT.

fields.name: price_components
fields.description: List of price components that describe the pricing of a tariff.

fields.name: restrictions
fields.description: Restrictions that describe the applicability of a tariff.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of tariff dimension.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price per unit (excl. VAT) for this tariff dimension.

fields.name: vat
fields.description: Applicable VAT percentage for this tariff dimension. If omitted, no VAT is applicable. Not providing a VAT is different from 0% VAT, which would be a value of 0.0 here.

fields.name: step_size
fields.description: Minimum amount to be billed. This unit will be billed in this step_size blocks. For example: if type is TIME and step_size has a value of 300, then time will be billed in blocks of 5 minutes. If 6 minutes were used, 10 minutes (2 blocks of step_size) will be billed.

enumValues.name: ENERGY
enumValues.description: Defined in kWh, step_size multiplier: 1 Wh

enumValues.name: FLAT
enumValues.description: Flat fee without unit for step_size

enumValues.name: PARKING_TIME
enumValues.description: Time not charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second

enumValues.name: TIME
enumValues.description: Time charging: defined in hours, step_size multiplier: 1 second Can also be used in combination with a RESERVATION restriction to describe the price of the reservation time.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: Start time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 13:30, valid from this time of the day. Must be in 24h format with leading zeros. Hour/Minute separator: ":" Regex: ([0-1][0-9]|2[1-3]):[0-5][0-9]

fields.name: end_time
fields.description: End time of day in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example 19:45, valid until this time of the day. Same syntax as start_time.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: Start date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-24, valid from this day. Regex: ([12][0-9]{3})-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: End date in local time, the time zone is defined in the time_zone field of the Location, for example: 2015-12-27, valid until this day (exclusive). Same syntax as start_date.

fields.name: min_kwh
fields.description: Minimum consumed energy in kWh, for example 20, valid from this amount of energy being used.

fields.name: max_kwh
fields.description: Maximum consumed energy in kWh, for example 50, valid until this amount of energy being used.

fields.name: min_current
fields.description: Sum of the minimum current in A over all phases, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of current, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging current is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is above the defined value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging current drops below the defined value.

fields.name: max_current
fields.description: Sum of the maximum current in A over all phases, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of current, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging current is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum current over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging current is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST  no longer be active when the charging current raises above the defined value.

fields.name: min_power
fields.description: Minimum power in kW, for example 5. When the EV is charging with more than the defined amount of power, this TariffElement is/becomes active. If the charging power is or becomes lower, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the minimum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is above this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power drops below the defined value.

fields.name: max_power
fields.description: Maximum power in kW, for example 20. When the EV is charging with less than the defined amount of power, this TariffElement becomes/is active. If the charging power is or becomes higher, this TariffElement is not or no longer valid and becomes inactive. This describes NOT the maximum power over the entire Charging Session. This restriction can make a TariffElement become active when the charging power is below this value, but the TariffElement MUST no longer be active when the charging power raises above the defined value.

fields.name: min_duration
fields.description: Minimum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (inclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is longer than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. Before that moment, this TariffElement is not yet active.

fields.name: max_duration
fields.description: Maximum duration in seconds the Charging Session MUST last (exclusive). When the duration of a Charging Session is shorter than the defined value, this TariffElement is or becomes active. After that moment, this TariffElement is no longer active.

fields.name: day_of_week
fields.description: Which day(s) of the week this TariffElement is active.

fields.name: reservation
fields.description: When this field is present, the TariffElement describes reservation costs. A reservation starts when the reservation is made, and ends when the drivers starts charging on the reserved EVSE/Location, or when the reservation expires. A reservation can only have: FLAT and TIME TariffDimensions, where TIME is for the duration of the reservation.

enumValues.name: RESERVATION
enumValues.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation.

enumValues.name: RESERVATION_EXPIRES
enumValues.description: Used in TariffElements to describe costs for a reservation that expires (i.e. driver does not start a charging session before expiry_date of the reservation).

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
